rComments: Environmental Art was an interesting course, but I wouldn't recommend this class if you 1. don't appreciate art and 2. don't have an open mind. Beth really knows her stuff, and her lectures are interesting. Not too much work to pass this class with an A, but I found it difficult to remain enthusiastic about this course.

Beth is truly an inspiring person amongst many other things. She will make you think and view things differently. She has been there for me. I recommend her to anyone, especially artists interested in the environment. I am taking more classes taught by her for sure.

Beth is wacky, but cool. Lectures are long and boring but can also be fun sometimes, it's a little hit or miss. Sometimes the relation between the readings and lectures isn't clear, but it doesn't matter. ART 80B is an easy A as long as you do the readings (which are easy) and weekly responses.

Vibrant lecturer! NO TEXTBOOK, all reading materials are online! Sometimes it's hard to connect the logic between the homework readings and the actual lectures. Documentarymovie nights are usually boring. If you just come to class and do the homework (which is usually a page summary of the reading every week) you should be set!

I feel like Beth is misrepresented, as all the comments are from kids who had her for Art 10, which is almost always a boring class. She's fantastic! In the upper division studios, she provides a very open environment for working on unstructured projects. This is extremely important in an upper div art class. I enjoy her as a teacher and a person.

She's a pretty good teacher. Shows a lot of slides about artists she knows and talks a lot about them (mostly the ones she's met and is friends with). Finals are take-home and easy. Sections are where you get the most out of the class though: hands-on work and actual learning. Lecture: visually nice. Sections: great discussions and work.

3D foundation is pointless. Great job UCSC for dropping the ball on Art! Elizabeth never says anything worth hearing but always asserts her opinions without any explanations. She just shows us slides of really pretentious art and drills over and over that it is "good". Pray your TA makes up for it all because sections are actually fun!
Beth Stephens is a hack. She thinks very highly of herself and teaches near to nothing. Don't take this class if your actually interested in learning something useful about 3D art.

Beth is passionate and fun--for this class, go with the mentality that in lecture you will learn about artists as if you were just having a casual conversation with one of their friends+slides of their work. Section is organized more like a traditional studio. Beth can come off as as a "bad" teacher if you're looking for a high-school style class.

Elizabeth Stephens is abrasive and pompous. She doesn't say anything important in lecture. She considers herself pretty special, making sure to let us know if she had any of the artist she talks about in lecture over for dinner. Anything I learned in this class came from my TA or the text book.
